titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Building Reference Collection, 1972 - 2004
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Nancy Perry; machine-readable finding aid created by: Jill Katte

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid derived from automated markup system. Date of source: 2003 Processed by Nancy Perry 2003; Finding Aid encoded by Jill Katte, University Archives, Duke University, April 2004April 2004

change.item: Converted from dtd to schema and transformed with AT-import-fixer.xsl
Added CIEMAS folder to container list.
PUBLIC "-//University Archives//TEXT (US::NDD::::Building Reference Collection)//EN" uabuilding.xml converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.xsl (sy2003-10-15).
Also, the top level of the finding aid (above the dsc) was changed to conform to the NC EAD Best Practice Guidelines. Within the dsc, dates for series were normalized.
Added box numbers and some new folders to container list. Added processing and update information.

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult University Archives, Duke University.
did.abstract: The Building Reference Collection contains files of clippings, publications, specifications, and other materials about the Duke University campus, including dormitories, classroom buildings, gymnasiums, stadiums, facilities, statues, and landmarks. Some files include information about the people after whom particular buildings were named. This collection was compiled from a variety of sources by the University Archives for use in reference and research. English.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Building Reference Collection, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Building Reference Collection was compiled by University Archives staff from a variety of sources.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Encoded by Jill Katte, April 2004, June 2006
